找.definition: to try to find; to look for; to call on sb; to find; to seek; to return; to give change

找上門.definition: to come to sb's door; to call on sb

找不自在.definition: to ask for trouble; to bring misfortune on oneself

找事.definition: to look for employment; to pick a quarrel

找台階兒.definition: to find an excuse; to look for a pretext

找尋.definition: to look for; to seek; to find fault

找對象.definition: to seek a marriage partner; looking for a mate

找岔子.definition: to look for blemishes; to find fault; nitpicking

找死.definition: to court death; to take a big risk

找碴兒.definition: to pick a quarrel; to find fault; nitpicking

找茬.definition: to pick fault with; to spot the differences; to nitpick; to pick a quarrel; to find complaint with

找補.definition: to compensate; to make up; to complement; to add

找見.definition: to find (sth one has been looking for)

找遍.definition: to search everywhere; to search high and low; to comb

找錢.definition: to give change; to seek funding; (dialect) to make money; to earn a living

找門路.definition: to seek help from social connections

找齊.definition: to make uniform; to even up; to make good a deficiency
